passages.text: EQUITY: METALS & MINING
Maintain Buy; TP increased to IDR4,500

ANTM delivered an impressive set of 2Q25 results, above our/consensus forecasts - 2Q25 earnings jumped to IDR2.6tn (+95% y-y, +20% q-q). Nickel segment was the main profit contributor, and its NPM rose to a record 54% (vs 35% in 1Q25). Overall revenue surged to IDR33tn (+126% y-y, +26% q-q), driven by record sales of gold and nickel ore. Gold NPM slowed to 5.4% (vs 7.9% in 1Q25). ANTM's Bauxite segment maintained its growth trajectory, following the commissioning of its SGA aluminum plant.

We note several catalysts underpinning ANTM's nickel growth: 1) Likely revised 2025E sales quota, targeting 20mn wmt, 2) earnings contribution following the rapid expansion at Weda Bay Nickel (WBN) with sales set to double in 2H25E under an increased RKAB quota to 42mn wmt (previously: 32mn wmt), 3) incremental volumes from new EV battery projects such as project Dragon (inaugurated in May- 25 and commissioning end of 2026) and project EV Titan. While we await further updates, we expect ANTM to more than double its nickel ore sales once its EV projects are fully commissioned (Fig. 3).

We raise our earnings forecasts by 43- 51% for FY25F- FY27F driven by the rapid growth of its nickel segment. We expect the nickel ore premium to persist through the rest of 2025F, which should help maintain its high margin. We still expect ANTM to produce 17mn wmt of ore this year, while we await updates on the quota revision. We raise our bauxite sales and gold sales estimates to reach a record 48 tons in 2025F. We expect WBN to recover in 2H25F supported by upside from its JV earnings contribution. ANTM's balance sheet is strong, having maintained a zero- debt position, and we calculate \(>12\%\) dividend yield for the next year.

We roll forward our valuation base to 2026 from 2025 and reaffirm Buy on ANTM with a higher TP of IDR4,500 (from IDR3,200), based on 7x FY26F EV/EBITDA or around - 0.5 SD of its 5Y average, implying 11.6 FY26F P/E (previously 7x target FY25F EV/EBITDA multiple). The stock currently trades at 8.5/7.6x FY25F/FY26F P/E. Our valuation does not incorporate future projects, i.e., battery plant. Downside risks include a decline in commodity prices, regulatory changes, setbacks to future projects.

PT Antam Tbk (short for Aneka Tambang) was incorporated in 1968 as a result of the merger between several state- owned mining companies to form a state- owned mining industry holding in Indonesia. In 1997, the company made an IPO in Indonesia with the ticker name ANTM IJ, followed by an IPO in Australia in 1999 to raise funds for its ferronickel project expansion. To date, ANTM is owned by PT Indonesia Asahan Aluminium (Indonesia's state- owned mining holding company - also known as Inalum) with a \(65\%\) stake, and public ownership with a \(35\%\) stake. The company is engaged in mining gold, silver, ferronickel, nickel ore, bauxite, and alum.
Our target price of IDR4,500 is based on 7x FY26F EV/EBITDA, at - 0.5 SD of its 5- year average. The benchmark index is JCI index.
Downside risks include a decline in the LME nickel price, regulatory changes and setbacks to future projects.

ANTM is taking various ESG effort by implementing Social & Environmental Responsibility Program (locally: TJSL program). The TJSL program aims to encourage and strengthen local SMEs by digitalization as well as developing local natural resources such as coconut products, local coffee in Halmahera, and various agrobusiness. Other than the program, the company also actively contribute to the local health especially those impacted by Covid.

A rating of 'Reduce', indicates that the analyst expects the stock to underperform the Benchmark over the next 12 months. A rating of 'Suspended', indicates that the rating, target price and estimates have been suspended temporarily to comply with applicable regulations and/or firm policies.
